snippet: The workers were protesting the government’s use of an emergency law to battle trade unions that oppose austerity measures.
abstract: Greek civil servants walked off the job to protest government’s use of emergency law to ban planned strike by teachers; rally is smallest in several months, sign that public support for country’s once-mighty unions may be dwindling.
lead_paragraph: The workers were protesting the government’s use of an emergency law to battle trade unions that oppose austerity measures.

headline.seo: Greek Civil Servants Walk Out Over Ban on Teachers’ Strike
headline.main: Greek Civil Servants Walk Out Over Ban on Teachers’ Strike
headline.print_headline: Greek Civil Servants Walk Out Over Ban on Teachers’ Strike
